qas.question: At which point in a game is the time the offence takes to put the ball in play measured?

answers.text: last three minutes of a half

qas.question: How many seconds elapse before a time count penalty is assessed?
What is the penalty for a time count on the first two downs?
Who can turn the ball over to the other side if an offensive team incurs too many time count violations?
How many yards does the offense lose for a time count on third down?
What is the penalty in American football for not having the down repeated within 20 seconds?
What is the penalty for convert attempts on the first two downs?

plausible_answers.text: for repeated deliberate time count violations on third down

qas.question: For what violation can the referee give the base penalty to the defense?
How many yards does the loss of down lose on third down?
On what down can the 20 second play clock give possession to the defense?

context: During the <a0_0>last three minutes of a half<a0_0/>, the penalty for failure to place the ball in play within the <a1_0>20<a1_0/>-second play clock, known as "time count" (this foul is known as "<b5_0>delay of game<b5_0/>" in American football), is dramatically different from during the first 27 minutes. Instead of the penalty being 5 yards with the down repeated, the base penalty (except during convert attempts) becomes <a2_0><b6_0>loss of down<b6_0/><a2_0/> on first or second down, and <a4_0><b8_0>10<b8_0/><a4_0/> yards on third down with the down repeated. In addition, as noted previously, the <a3_0>referee<a3_0/> can give possession to the defence <b7_0>for repeated deliberate time count violations on <b9_0>third down<b9_0/><b7_0/>.
